Interface PropertiesInterface

All Superinterfaces:
LoggingInterface
All Known Implementing Classes:
PropertiesAndArguments
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface PropertiesInterface extends LoggingInterface
Interface to manage properties and cmd-line arguments.
See Also:
  • PropertiesAndArguments

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final Map<String,Object>
    properties
    Simple map of String names and values, keeping their type by applying properlyCast(String) method.

  • Field Details

    • properties

      static final Map<String,Object> properties
      Simple map of String names and values, keeping their type by applying properlyCast(String) method.

  • Method Details

    • loadCmdLnArgs

      static void loadCmdLnArgs(String... args)
      Loads given arguments to properties map. Each argument must begin with --, and values can be pointed either by space, = or : (i.e. --argument=value).

    • loadAppProperties

      static void loadAppProperties(String propertiesPath)
      Loads properties from given path. Uses Properties to parse.

    • load

      static void load(String propertiesPath, String... args)
      Loads cmd-line args and app properties together.
      See Also:
      • loadCmdLnArgs(String...)
      • loadAppProperties(String)

      static String printAll()

    • areAny

    • value

      default Optional<Object> value()
      Returns:
      Optional property's value.

    • isPresent

      default boolean isPresent()
      Returns:
      True if the property has been listed.

    • set

      default Object set(Object value)
      Equivalent of Map.put(Object, Object), sets the value for this property.

    • set

      default Object set(String value)
      Does value casting before putting to the list.
      See Also:
      • properlyCast(String)
